column2: A fighter had the nerve to insult me in front of several of the other attending warriors. The look on his face when I challenged him to a duel revealed him for the coward he was, but honor left him no choice but to accept. I showed no mercy when I cut him down in single combat.

column2: As I waited my turn in the archery contest, I came across two bedouins, fierce warriors both, who were plotting to get back at a young noble who had dismissed them as desert rabble. I watched as they carefully cut the girth of the noble's saddle just enough to ensure it would snap during the upcoming riding challenge.

column2: As I waited my turn in the archery contest, I came across two bedouins, fierce warriors both, who were plotting to get back at a young noble who had dismissed them as desert rabble. I told them to face the man directly instead of scheming behind his back like bitter old women!
